definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: The government never rejected Taipei Mayor Ma Ying-joue's visa application to visit Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 政府從來沒有拒絕馬英九來港的簽證申請。

sentences.english: Visitor arrivals dropped by one-third between mid-March and mid-April.
sentences.chinese: 三月中至四月中期間來港旅客人數下跌三分之一。

sentences.english: More overseas talent is likely to be allowed in.
sentences.chinese: 未來將會允許更多專才來港。

sentences.english: The Immigration Department admitted 3,745 professionals from the mainland last year.
sentences.chinese: 入境處去年批准3，745名內地專才來港。

sentences.english: My knowledge all came in drips and drabs after I got there.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是來港後一點一滴逐漸認識的。

sentences.english: If Hong Kong dollars depreciate against with RMB, it is easy to attract more China tourist to visit Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 若港元對人民幣貶值，會較易吸引內地遊客來港消費。

sentences.english: The government will also increase testing of chickens that cross the border with mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 政府還將對內地來港雞隻加強檢驗。

sentences.english: The Immigration Department admitted 3，745 professionals from the mainland last year.
sentences.chinese: 入境處去年批准3，745名內地專才來港。

sentences.english: I'm honoured to be here and looking forward to tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 我很榮幸能夠來港作賽，並很期待明晚的賽事。
